oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Comparing 0.9% sterile saline to phosphate buffered saline as a transport media for Tritrichomonas foetus RT-qPCR testing
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jumper, T.M.
Thoresen, M.
King, E.H.
Smith, D.R.
Loy, D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The limit of detection for T. foetus RT-qPCR is 1 organism/ex­traction in phosphate buffered saline (PBS) without prior cul­ture. The objective of this study was to determine if 0.9% ster­ile saline (SAL), a readily available media, was not inferior to PBS as a transport media for T. foetus RT-qPCR testing at that concentration.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; Vol. 58 No. 58 (2024): 2024 AABP Annual Conference Proceedings; 201
